candidates.title: chore: widen range on statrs
candidates.body:
They didn't actually make breaking changes.

Also, due to a disagreement between the common meaning of semver for
pre-1.0 releases and how the release-please bot works, someone needs to
merge a commit with this line in it, so it might as well be this one:

Release-As: 0.42.0

Allow update of strum to latest version.

Nothing actually depends on fnv.

candidates.title: chore: Allow update of petgraph to 0.6.
chore: Add minimum supported Rust version to README and CI
candidates.body:
I bisected Rust versions with the current `master` branch and found it doesn't work before `1.51.0` (due to `nalgebra` using const generics). This PR add a section to README pointing what is the MSRV, and a CI check to see if they match (and if building/testing works on the MSRV).

With this the `build.rs` file can also be removed, since `u128` is supported since Rust `1.26` (and we don't support anything so old anyway). [^1]

[^1]: The `build.rs` was copied from [`num-traits`](https://github.com/rust-num/num-traits/blob/master/build.rs), which changed over time (and the crate still supports Rust `1.8`, which is pretty amazing...)

candidates.title: chore: Update dependencies and clean up crate archive.
candidates.body:
Allow triple_accel version 0.4.
Allow getset 1.x
Remove uses of deprecated enum-map functionality, and allow use of 1.x.

Exclude benches, tests, .github, .gitignore, etc. from the crate archive.
This reduces crate archive size by ~20%.

candidates.title: chore: Widen dependency version ranges.
candidates.body:
* Permit itertools 0.10
* Permit ndarray 0.15
* Permit approx 0.4 and 0.5 (ndarray 0.15 depends on approx 0.5)
* Permit 0.8.x (previously limited to 0.8.0)
* Permit strum/strum_macros 0.20.x and 0.21
* Permit rand 0.8 (which was already a dev dependency)

candidates.title: feat: Baum-Welch algorithm for Discrete HMM
update crates so that users can use rand version 0.8.3
candidates.body:
Currently users of the bio 0.34 will have rand 0.7.3 as a dependency.  This change
allows the rand dependency to advance to 0.8.3.  It would be great if a release could 
be made with this change.

candidates.title: Allow user to control size of reading and writting buffer
candidates.body:
This pull request try to solve issue #258.

I add constructor `from_file_with_capacity`, `with_capacity`, `from_bufreader` to `Reader` and `with_capacity`, `to_file_with_capacity` to `Writer`.

I also add a benchmark to demonstrate, this constructor is more efficient than build a `BufReader` and give it to `new` constructor. Benchmark run on my XPS13 with SSD.

```
test fasta_buffer::default           ... bench:     151,396 ns/iter (+/- 1,561)
test fasta_buffer::wrapped_default   ... bench:     145,718 ns/iter (+/- 2,595)
test fasta_buffer::capacity_default  ... bench:     139,736 ns/iter (+/- 27,226)
test fasta_buffer::bufreader_default ... bench:     138,331 ns/iter (+/- 2,336)

test fasta_buffer::wrapped_32768     ... bench:     147,414 ns/iter (+/- 1,752)
test fasta_buffer::capacity_32768    ... bench:     139,956 ns/iter (+/- 30,602)
test fasta_buffer::bufreader_32768   ... bench:     138,981 ns/iter (+/- 19,455)
```

Should I replace`from_bufreader` by `from_bufread` to be more generic ? But this change require a modification of structure `Reader` and `Writer` and maybe break compatibility, I'm not sure it's a good idea.

Todo list:
----------------------------------
- [X] fasta
- [x] fastq

candidates.title: Add context containing path for io modules
candidates.body:
This PR adds an anyhow context with the according file path to all readers from the io modules. This should be beneficial for dependent crates like for example [rbt](https://github.com/rust-bio/rust-bio-tools) where boilerplate code like `.with_context(|| format!("Failed to read fastq from {:#?}", path))` for every reader becomes obsolete. 

I also removed some unused dependencies from the `Cargo.toml` and added some missing tests for fasta, gff and bed readers.

candidates.title: Update strum version ranges
candidates.body:
It appears to only be used for #[strum(serialize = "XXXX")] which does
not seem likely to break anything per the changelog:

https://github.com/Peternator7/strum/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md

candidates.title: Update ndarray and statrs allowed versions.
candidates.body:
Enable newer versions of ndarray to be used without splitting dependencies.

`ndarray` 0.14 changes are described here: https://github.com/rust-ndarray/ndarray/blob/master/RELEASES.md, and none of the API changes (renaming of stack -> concatenate, removal of subview* methods) seem to affect this repository.

`statrs` changes are described here: https://github.com/boxtown/statrs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md and appear to only add features instead of changing any existing functionality.

candidates.title: Switch from snafu to thiserror
candidates.body: Basically a big search & replace to replace `snafu`-based custom error types to `thiserror`-based ones, as per #341.

candidates.title: Add a parser for Newick phylogenetic trees
candidates.body:
The feature is gated behind a 'phylogeny' feature gate to reduce as
much as can be dependencies count and compilation time.

It requires a compatible version of rust-bio-types, containing the
phylogeny::Tree type.

snafu is re-used from the global dependencies pool for error management.

repo.name: rust-bio
repo.description: This library provides implementations of many algorithms and data structures that are useful for bioinformatics. All provided implementations are rigorously tested via continuous integration.
